title: Cygnus mission to ISS scrapped after finding spacecraft damage
summary:
NASA and Northrop Grumman will not launch a Cygnus cargo mission to the ISS in June as previously planned after discovering the spacecraft is damaged.
The post Cygnus mission to ISS scrapped after finding spacecraft damage appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Anywaves poised to expand antenna production in France and internationally
summary:
SAN FRANCISCO – French antenna manufacturer Anywaves announced plans March 27 to begin producing satellite antennas and radio-frequency payloads in-house, a prelude to establishing a U.S. facility. To serve international […]
The post Anywaves poised to expand antenna production in France and internationally appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: ESA’s Gaia spacecraft leaves for retirement orbit
summary: From 25 July 2014 to 15 January 2025, the Gaia space observatory performed high-precision measurements of nearly two billion stars from its Lissajous orbit around the L2 Lagrange point, 1.5 million km from Earth.

title: Farewell, Gaia! Spacecraft operations come to an end
summary: The European Space Agency (ESA) has powered down its Gaia spacecraft after more than a decade spent gathering data that are now being used to unravel the secrets of our home galaxy.

title: Webb spies a spiral through a cosmic lens
U.S. Space Force certifies ULA’s Vulcan rocket to begin launching national security missions
summary: The conclusion of certification closes out a process that began in September 2016 and saw the government closely track the development of Vulcan alongside United Launch Alliance. Its first National Security Space Launch mission is targeting liftoff over the summer.

title: Sols 4491-4492: Classic Field Geology Pose
summary: Written by Lauren Edgar, Planetary Geologist at USGS Astrogeology Science Center Earth planning date: Monday, March 24, 2025 If you’ve ever seen a geologist in the field, you may have seen a classic stance: one leg propped up on a rock, knee bent, head down looking at the rocks at their feet, and arm pointing […]

title: U.S. military prepares to award new commercial satcom deals
summary:
The Commercial Satellite Communications Office last week issued a final solicitation for bids for the Marine Enterprise Commercial Satellite Services (MECS2) contract

title: China launches new Tianlian data relay satellite to support human spaceflight
summary:

title: NASA sidelines Cygnus spacecraft after damage in transit to launch site
summary: "Following initial evaluation, there also is damage to the cargo module."
